|brand = Intel |model = WiFi Link 5300 |submodelappend = yes |submodel = 533AN_HMW (half size) |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = June 26, 2010 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Intel_WiFi_Link_5300_(half_size) |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |wlclass = AN900 |series = <!-- Device series --> |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = <!-- ie. 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.2 --> |ifconnector = <!-- Interface Connector Type, Leave blank for none --> |formfactor = (half)
|vendor_id = 8086 |device_id = 4235 |subvendor_id = 8086 |subdevice_id = 1011 |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = PD9533ANH, PD9533ANHU |icid = 1000M-533ANH, 1000M-533ANHU |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:21:6A
|chip1 = Intel;JC82539MDE; |chip2 = Intel;JC82539RDE; |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = U.FL |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 3 |rxchains = 3 |sstreams = 3 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 450 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv =
|is_manuf = No |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |flags = DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = |accessible_JTAG = |category =
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 07/07/2008 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B00B0RRIJ8 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = China
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This card is assumed to be using the JC82539 chipset (JC82539MDE + JC82539RDE).
Many more PCI subsystems exist for this device..
The card is used in (at least) the following... *'''[[Dell]]''' Adamo **[http://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Dell+Adamo+Teardown/719/2 iFixit teardown] ***FCC ID: E2K533ANH, IC ID: 1514B-533ANH, '''Dell''' P/N: 0KW374, 00:21:6A OUI, TA: E14715-010
Be wary of buying cards of this type with unknown origin if you plan on using these cards in a '''Linux''' environment. '''Many''' on eBay (and the like) are engineering samples and will not function (by default) with the in-kernel driver. The drivers ('''compat-drivers''' would be easiest to work with) will need to be patched (and the minimum EEPROM version check removed) to function with these devices. *[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1709865 '''''Intel Wifi Link 5300, 6200, 6300 and Ubuntu 10.10''''' on '''ubuntuforums.org'''] *[http://forums.gentoo.org/viewtopic-t-872841-start-0.html '''''Little hack needed to get Intel AGN 5300 work''''' on the '''Gentoo''' forums]
Note that the 5300 series cards are also available in vendor-specific models which are not cross-compatible with standard Windows drivers, resulting in a driver error "This device cannot start. (Code 10)"
* Dell P/N: 0KW374 (PCI Device 8086 4235)
* IBM/Lenovo C/M: 533ANHU (PCI Device 8086 4236)
[[Category:English Documentation]]
